meanings.definition: The quality of a substance that affects the sense of taste.
meanings.sent1: The sapor of the soup was rich and savory.
meanings.sent2: I could detect a hint of citrus sapor in the dish.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected sapor of the ice cream made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: Her words had a bitter sapor that lingered in the air.
meanings.sent5: The sapor of freshly baked bread filled the room with warmth.

meanings.sent1: The sapor of the fruit was sweet and refreshing.
meanings.sent2: He couldn't identify the unfamiliar sapor in the sauce.
meanings.sent3: The exotic sapor of the dish transported me to a faraway land.
meanings.sent4: The sapor of success was evident in her satisfied smile.
meanings.sent5: Each herb added a unique sapor to the soup, creating a harmonious blend.
